title: Multinationals, Institutions and Innovation in Europe
descriptions:
Title: Multinationals, Institutions and Innovation in Europe

Abstract:
This grant proposal seeks to investigate the location strategies of Multinational Enterprises (MNEs) and their territorial impacts in Europe. With MNEs contributing over a quarter of global GDP, equivalent to US$16 trillion in value added, understanding their role in shaping regional development is crucial. The significant increase in Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) outflows from developing economies, rising from 16% in 2007 to 31% in 2012, with a total of $426 billion in 2012, underscores the need for research in this area. This project aims to address existing gaps in literature and provide policy-making tools to support informed decision-making. By examining the complex relationships between MNEs, institutions, and innovation, this study will shed light on the spatial implications of MNE activities and contribute to the development of effective regional development policies in Europe. The expected outcomes will inform policymakers and stakeholders, ultimately enhancing the competitiveness and sustainability of European regions.
